bug.author: MuLx10
bug.summary: Cannot load text in CSV files
bug.description:
For the csv file
1 row 2 row 3
2 "row 2, with comma" row 3
3 row 2 with "embedded quote" row 3
4 row 2 with \n new line row 3
5 row 2 with embedded \ row 3
11
row 33
data::Load("data.csv", dataset, info,false,true); dataset.print("dataset: ");
std::cout << "Data :" << std::endl; for (size_t i = 0;i<dataset.n_cols;i++){ std::cout<<dataset.at(0,i)<<"\t"; for (size_t j = 1; j < info.Dimensionality(); ++j) std::cout<<info.UnmapString(dataset.at(j,i),j,0)<<"\t" ; std::cout<<std::endl; } <denchmark-h:h4>Issue description</denchmark-h>
For the csv file, the above snippet produces: <denchmark-code>[WARN ] LoadCSV::TransposeParse(): wrong number of dimensions (3) on line 5; should be 2 dimensions. dataset: 1.0000 2.0000 3.0000 4.0000 5.0000 11.0000 0 1.0000 0 0 0 2.0000 Data : 1 row 2 "row 3 row 4 row 5 row 11 </denchmark-code>
It also affects the issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/1725>#1725</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h4>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>dataset: 1.0000 2.0000 3.0000 4.0000 5.0000 11.0000 0 1.0000 2.0000 3.0000 4.0000 5.0000 0 0 0 0 0 1.0000 Data : 1 row 2 row 3 2 "row 2, with comma" row 3 3 row 2 with \"embedded quote\" row 3 4 row 2 with \n new line row 3 5 row 2 with embedded \\ row 3 11 row 33 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>Steps to Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run this <denchmark-link:https://pastebin.com/xGnPQmDi>code</denchmark-link> .

comments.comment: I think that mlpack works only with numeric matrices.so instaed of having text map it with some numeric value.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sumit-03>@sumit-03</denchmark-link> but consider that the categorical features are two words long. Then mlpack would just map the first word. So after prediction unmapping, the categorical label would go incorrect.

if mlpack is mapping based on only first word then it will go wrong but first you have to see how that method is implemented. I agree <denchmark-link:#>‚Ä¶</denchmark-link>
On Wed, 6 Mar 2019, 1:59 p.m. Mehul Kumar Nirala ***@***.*** wrote: @sumit-03 <https://github.com/sumit-03> but consider that the categorical features are two words long. Then mlpack would just map the first word. So after prediction unmapping, the categorical label would go incorrect.
